prediction.overall_explanation: No concrete, externally exploitable vulnerabilities were found in this contract alone. All state-changing user entrypoints that affect voting state (vote/reset/poke) are guarded by ownership/approval checks and protected by nonReentrant, and state changes revert atomically if bribe/gauge calls fail. Potential issues like division-by-zero or duplicate pools only let the caller revert their own transaction (self-DoS), not an attacker drain funds or manipulate others’ votes. Admin functions are privileged by design and not counted as exploits.
